events.title: Pilgrims Land at Plymouth Rock
events.description: The Pilgrims aboard the Mayflower landed at Plymouth Rock, establishing Plymouth Colony in present-day Massachusetts. This marked one of the earliest successful English settlements in North America.
events.significance: This event is significant as it laid the foundations for future English colonization and American history, symbolizing early steps toward the United States.

events.title: Ratification of the 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution
events.description: The United States officially ratified the 13th Amendment, abolishing slavery throughout the country.
events.significance: The amendment ended the legal practice of slavery in the U.S., marking a pivotal moment in American civil rights and history.

events.title: The Battle of Verdun Ends
events.description: After nearly 10 months of brutal fighting, the Battle of Verdun in World War I officially ended with the French retaining control of the fortifications.
events.significance: One of the longest and bloodiest battles of WWI, it symbolized French resistance and had a lasting impact on military strategy and national morale.

events.title: Kyoto Protocol Adopted
events.description: The Kyoto Protocol, an international treaty committing its parties to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, was adopted in Kyoto, Japan.
events.significance: This marked a milestone in global efforts to address climate change, initiating legally binding obligations for developed countries.
